Dear Ana McClain:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Shannon Mavis, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of Staff
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continue needs, protection and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 2/26/23, youth was found in a closet and admitted to ingesting
laundry detergent. On the same date, another youth was found
with hand sanitizer in their room and also admitted to ingesting it.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant/Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed via
telephone on 2/27/23 and face to face at the facility on 3/1/23.
CA reported Youth A was on full restrictions and precautions after
the incident with the laundry detergent because Youth A’s intent
was self-harm. CA reported Youth B was not on restrictions or
precautions after the hand sanitizer incident because Youth B’s
intent was to get drunk and not to self-harm. Youth A accessed
2

the laundry detergent because it was in the activity closet, which
can be accessed by youth under staff supervision. CA reported at
the time of the incident, the activity closet was propped open and
had been for hours. Laundry detergent has always been in the
activity closet and typically staff use the laundry detergent bottles
to prop the door. Laundry detergent was in the activity closet
because it was a low-risk chemical, and they use it frequently to
teach the youth independent living skills. All laundry detergent has
been moved to the janitor’s closet, which no youth can access. CA
reported she is not sure where Youth B received the hand
sanitizer from as it is not the same kind they utilize at the facility.
CA reported all hand sanitizer is removed from the unit and they
are ensuring all hand sanitizer is non-alcoholic moving forward.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/1/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported she was
eating dinner in the dining room of the milieu. After dinner, she
saw the activity closet door was propped open, so she went into
the activity closet and drank three handfuls of laundry detergent.
She reported she shut the door, but the light was still on. She
reported staff did not know she was in there until another youth
suggested she may be in the activity closet, which is when Staff 5
opened the door and found her. She estimates being in the activity
closet with the door shut for about 10-15 minutes. Youth A
reported she does not need staff to go with her into the activity
closet, but she stated she is supposed to ask permission before
entering the closet, which she did not do. She reported she has
never drunk laundry detergent before.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/1/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported on
2/26/23, staff could not find Youth A, so Youth B suggested they
look in the activity closet. She reported she made this suggestion
because when she used to self-harm, she would do it by ingesting
chemicals, and she noticed the activity room door was shut. Youth
B reported all youth had to go to their rooms while staff addressed
the situation with Youth A. Youth B reported the incident with
Youth A triggered her, so she began punching her pillow and the
wall in her room. Youth B stated the youth on the other side of her
bedroom wall began screaming and yelling at her to stop. Youth B
stated she threatened the other youth and told her to come out of
her room so they could fight in the hallway. Youth B reported she
opened her door and went into the hallway, but the other youth
would not fully come out of her room. Staff 5 came to intervene
and stood in between them in the hallway while trying to talk them
down and instructing them to go back into their rooms. When
3

Youth B was re-entering her room, she reported Staff 5 noticed
Youth B had a bottle of hand sanitizer in her room. Staff 5 asked
Youth B if the hand sanitizer had alcohol in it. Youth B said it did
and Staff 5 told Youth B she was not supposed to have it. Youth B
reported Staff 5 took the hand sanitizer from her, but Youth B
grabbed it back. Youth B reported Staff 5 did not grab it back from
her again. While her bedroom door was still open, Youth B stated
she asked another youth if she could get drunk by drinking hand
sanitizer with alcohol in it and the youth told her she could. Youth
B reported Staff 5 left the room and came back about an hour
later. Staff 5 and other staff came to her room and took her heated
blanket, soap, hand sanitizer, gel, glue sticks and a cup. Youth B
reported the cup had a mix of hand sanitizer and water, which is
what she was drinking after Staff 5 left the first time.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/1/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker and via phone on 4/17/23.
Therapist stated Youth B has not been on precautions since being
at the facility. The hand sanitizer on the wall on the unit as well as
in the staff office is non-alcoholic, but the hand sanitizer Youth B
had was the brand Purel, which is alcoholic. Therapist reported
Youth B told her she received the hand sanitizer as a Christmas
gift. Therapist reported typically the gifts would be checked prior to
the youth bringing them to their rooms, so she is not sure how the
hand sanitizer ended up in Youth B’s room. Therapist reported
when Youth A was found in the activity closet, she came out
willingly and voluntarily went to the hospital. Since coming back
from the hospital, Youth A has been on high-risk precautions,
which means she can only have her bedding, no access to items
for self-harm and increased supervision. Therapist stated prior to
this incident, Youth A had not been on precautions since 2/1/23.
Therapist reported after Youth A was taken off of precautions on
2/1/23, staff were instructed to monitor calls between Youth A and
her family, monitor her behavior after calls, monitor her very
closely, and not allow her access to any of her personal sharp
items without supervision. Therapist reported Youth A’s personal
sharp items were kept locked up in the staff office and Youth A
could request them and utilize them under staff supervision.
Therapist also reported Youth A’s psychiatric appointments were
increased to weekly and as requested to address Youth A’s
concerns with her medications and make changes as deemed
necessary by the psychiatrist.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 3/8/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported she worked 2nd shift on
2/26/23. When she started her shift, Youth A told Staff 1 she was
4

having negative thoughts, felt sad, and said she wished she could
overdose. Staff 1 told Supervisor 1 about the feelings and
thoughts Youth A was having. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A should
not have access to any sharps but did not give any other
instructions or put any other precautions in place. Staff 1 reported
she was in the kitchen helping two other youth with baking cookies
while Supervisor 1, Staff 2 and Staff 5 were in the milieu area with
the rest of the youth, including Youth A. Staff 1 exited the kitchen
to tell Youth A it was almost her turn to bake cookies. Staff 1 did
not see Youth A in the milieu, and no one knew where she was.
Staff 1 reported she checked the TV room, bathroom, and
bedroom twice, but Youth A was not in any of those rooms. Youth
B then suggested staff check the activity closet, which is where
Staff 5 found Youth A. Youth A told all staff the laundry soap
burned in her throat and her stomach. Supervisor 1 called poison
control and followed their instructions. Afterwards, Youth A
voluntarily went to the hospital with Staff 1 and Staff 2 to ensure
she was okay. Staff 1 reported she could not remember if the
activity closet door was open or closed. She reported she thinks
the activity closet door is supposed to always be closed, but she
could not remember. She reported the youth can go into the
activity closet by themselves but are not allowed to go into the
other closet inside the activity closet. Staff 1 was unsure how long
Youth A was out of staffs’ viewpoint before they noticed Youth A
was missing.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 3/8/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported he came on shift around 6
pm on 2/26/23. Staff 2 stated everyone was finishing dinner,
cleaning up and Staff 1 was in the kitchen with two youth baking
cookies. Staff 2 reported Supervisor 1 was in the office preparing
medications for the youth and he and Staff 5 were in the milieu
area with the rest of the youth. Staff 2 reported Youth A was sitting
at the dining room table with a couple other youth and they were
singing songs and talking. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 came out of the
kitchen and asked where Youth A was, which is when they all
noticed Youth A was no longer in the milieu. Staff 2 reported he
does not know when Youth A left the milieu, is not sure how she
left the milieu without anyone noticing and is not sure how long
she was gone. Staff 2 reported Youth B suggested checking in the
activity closet, which is where Staff 5 found Youth A. Supervisor 1
called poison control, they gave her food and milk per poison
control’s direction, and then Youth A voluntarily went to the
hospital with Staff 1 and Staff 2. Staff 2 reported he did not see
the activity closet door open or propped, but the kitchen door was
open all the way, which blocks about half of the activity closet
5

door. Staff 2 stated the activity closet door is supposed to be
closed and is not supposed to be propped unless they’re cleaning
or utilizing the laundry detergent for independent living skills.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on 3/8/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported she worked 7am-3pm on
2/26/23. Staff 3 reported she asked Staff 5 to clear the unit and
put the mop buckets and cleaning supplies away. Staff 3 reported
all the supplies either go into the activity closet or the closet inside
the activity closet. Staff 3 reported she was not sure if Staff 5
closed the activity closet door when she was done putting the
items away.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on 3/8/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 stated she was the on-campus
supervisor the night of 2/26/23 and is responsible for responding
to calls from various units. That evening she responded to a call
requesting assistance due to Youth B not giving up her bottle of
hand sanitizer. When Staff 4 was on the unit, Youth B would not
give her the hand sanitizer the first time Staff 4 asked. The second
time Staff 4 asked for it, Youth B gave her the hand sanitizer
bottle, but it was cloudy and did not seem like it was hand
sanitizer. Staff 4 looked in Youth B’s room and found some hand
sanitizer in a cup combined with water. When Staff 4 asked Youth
B if she drank it, Youth B confirmed she did. Staff 4 proceeded to
call poison control and attempted to treat Youth B per their
recommendations, but Youth B refused to comply.
Staff 5 was interviewed via phone on 3/24/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 reported during staff debrief
between 1st and 2nd shift, Staff 3 told her not to prop any doors
open and be mindful of her surroundings because Youth A was
upset, and they did not want Youth A to harm herself. Staff 5
reported she put the mop and cleaning stuff away in the activity
closet and the closet within the activity closet. She stated after she
put them away, the door shut and locked automatically. She
reported she does not remember where Youth A was in the milieu
area after dinner, but stated she was sitting on a couch with two
youth and her back was facing the dining table. After it was
learned Youth A was missing, Staff 5 found Youth A in the activity
closet. Staff 5 reported Youth A did not have anything in her hand
and did not have any laundry soap or laundry soap containers
around her when she found her. Staff 5 does not know how Youth
A got into the activity closet because it is typically left shut and
locked. Staff 5 could not provide an estimated time for how long
Youth A was gone before staff noticed she was missing. After
6

Youth A was taken to the hospital, Staff 5 heard Youth B and
another youth yelling at each other, so she went to intervene. She
stood in the hallway between the youths’ bedrooms and was trying
to deescalate them. She noticed Youth B had hand sanitizer, so
she asked Youth B about it. Youth B then threw the hand sanitizer
in her clothes and refused to give it to Staff 5. Staff 5 felt the only
way to get the hand sanitizer would be to restrain Youth B, which
she did not want to do. Staff 5 stated she was going to tell
Supervisor 1 what was going on when she heard Youth B ask
another youth if she could get drunk by drinking hand sanitizer
with alcohol in it. The other youth told Youth B she could. Staff 5
left the area, told Supervisor 1 what was happening. Supervisor 1
called Staff 4 and asked for additional assistance. Staff 5 reported
she was away from Youth B’s room for approximately 5 minutes
before she then went back to Youth B’s room to check on her.
Staff 5 reported she looked in the window of Youth B’s room and
Youth B was calm and was not doing anything at the time she
came back so she stood in the hallway until Staff 4 arrived. Staff 5
reported she did not have Youth B’s bedroom door propped open
and was not directly observing her the whole time while waiting for
Staff 4. Staff 5 reported Staff 4 arrived about 10-15 minutes later
and retrieved the hand sanitizer from Youth B.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed via phone on 3/8/23 in
conjunction with MDHHS Worker and again on 4/12/23.
Supervisor 1 reported Youth A finished a Zoom call during 1st shift
on 2/26/23 and was acting a little different. Supervisor 1 reported
Staff 1 never told her Youth A stated she felt bad, was having
negative thoughts, and wished she could overdose. Supervisor 1
reported Staff 1 told her Youth A seemed upset, but it is not
unusual for a youth to feel upset after a phone call with family.
Supervisor 1 asked Youth A if she was okay and Youth A said yes
and asked for scissors to take down her hair. Supervisor 1 asked
Staff 1 to assist Youth A so Youth A would not have access to any
sharps because Youth A can be unpredictable, especially when
she is upset. Supervisor 1 also asked staff to put away the mop
buckets, so Staff 5 and another staff put away the buckets in the
closet within the activity closet. Supervisor 1 noted Staff 5 was the
last one she saw in the activity closet, so Staff 5 must not have
shut the door fully. Supervisor 1 reported when the kitchen door is
open, it covers about half of the activity closet doorway, so it is
hard to see if the activity room door was fully closed or not.
Supervisor 1 reported after dinner, Staff 1 was assisting with a
baking activity in the kitchen while Staff 2 and Staff 5 were in the
milieu with the youth and Supervisor 1 was in the office.
Supervisor 1 reported she last saw Youth A at the dining table.
7

Supervisor 1 reported staff found Youth A in the activity closet.
Supervisor 1 noted when staff were talking to Youth A in the
activity closet, the activity door was propped open, but she did not
see it propped open prior to that time. Youth A reported she drank
2 handfuls of laundry detergent. Supervisor 1 called poison control
and nursing. Supervisor 1 noted after the incident, they removed
all objects like silverware, pop cans, and paper from the unit.
Youth A then went to the hospital with Staff 1 and Staff 2.
Supervisor 1 and Staff 5 stripped Youth A’s room while she was at
the hospital as she was being placed on high-risk precautions
after she returned from the hospital. Supervisor 1 reported Youth
A was not on any suicide precaution risk status prior to this
incident occurring. Supervisor 1 was not in the milieu and was not
sure how long Youth A was out of staff supervision before they
noticed she was missing. Supervisor 1 reported she was on the
phone with poison control for the situation regarding Youth A
when she heard a commotion down the bedroom hallway. She
reported she contacted Staff 4 and asked for additional
assistance. Supervisor 1 reported she went into the hallway and
saw Staff 5 standing between the two rooms. Supervisor 1
reported they attempted to enter Youth B’s room, but Youth B had
stuff propped up against the door, making it difficult for them to
enter. Supervisor 1 stated Youth B also had her mattress against
the door, covering half of the window to the bedroom door.
Supervisor 1 stated after Staff 4 arrived, Staff 4 was able to talk
Youth B into moving the items away from the door so staff could
open the door. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 5 never left the hallway
and Staff 5 remained there during the duration of the incident.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed via phone on 3/8/23 in
conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor 2 was not working
when the incidents occurred on 2/26/23, but she is the Home
Supervisor and leads staff meetings, sends out staff notifications,
etc. Supervisor 2 reported the activity closet door should be
locked if it is shut and should never be propped open. Supervisor
2 reported this has been discussed in team meetings and emails
have been sent out explaining staff should not prop the activity
closet door open due to safety concerns. Supervisor 2 reported
new staff are trained about the same guidelines during orientation.
Supervisor 2 reported when Youth A first entered the program,
they knew she would scratch herself to self-harm, but found out
within the first 3 weeks Youth A would utilize anything at her
disposal to self-harm. Supervisor 2 reported this information was
discussed with staff and staff were instructed to be even more
vigilant, not to leave access to the activity closet, etc. Supervisor 2
reported they talk about not leaving the activity closet door open
8

for safety in general but wanted staff to know there needed to be
heightened awareness due to Youth A’s self-harm history.
Supervisor 2 reported there is not a policy stating the door must
be locked and there is no sign on the door saying it cannot be
propped, but it is expected staff are always monitoring it.
Supervisor 2 reported liquids the youth receive (such as hand
sanitizer, shampoo, body wash, perfume, and lotions) should not
be in youths’ rooms and should be kept in the staff office.
Supervisor 2 reported Youth B and another youth both had bottles
of hand sanitizer in their rooms, which should have been taken so
she’s not sure how they got the hand sanitizer or how the hand
sanitizer ended up in the youths’ rooms. Supervisor 2 reported
they conduct room searches if they have a suspicion of a safety
concern, but not otherwise.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Significant Event Report dated 2/26/23 regarding Youth A
and the laundry detergent states youth were preparing to
have free time and groups of two participated in a baking
activity in the kitchen. Youth A was found in the activity
closet room licking Action Chemical Liquid Laundry
Detergent from her hand. Nursing and poison control were
contacted. Youth A went to the hospital and when she
returned, she was placed on high-risk precautions. Notes
laundry detergent was removed from activity closet area so
it would not be accessible to youth while gathering activity
supplies from the closet during free time.
• Picture of Kitchen door open in front of Activity Closet door.
When the kitchen door is open it covers approximately half
of the activity closet door.
• Wedgwood Christian Services Client Safety Policy (rev.
4/18/18) states staff members are responsible to always
provide direct ongoing supervision of youth, which includes
implementation of specific supervision practices necessary
to ensure youth safety. Staff members are to take head
counts of youth no less than every fifteen minutes.
• Wedgwood Christian Services Staff Ratio Procedures (rev.
8/11/22) states direct care staff members are required to
always maintain line-of sight supervision of youths except
when youth are in their individual sleeping rooms or
bathrooms.
9

• Wedgwood Christian Services Team Meeting Form dated
11/22/22 states all chemicals must be locked and no
propping of doors. Team Meeting Form dated 1/19/23
states Chief Administrator held a discussion with staff
regarding doors.
• Harbor Oaks Hospital Initial Psychiatric Evaluation for
Youth A dated 12/3/22 states Youth A has three past
psychiatric hospitalizations. She has multiple past suicide
attempts including an overdose which ended up with her on
a ventilator.
• Wedgwood Christian Services Psychiatric Report regarding
Youth A dated 2/1/23 states Youth A remains mentally
unstable and is observed to be searching for items to self-
harm with (i.e., scratching self with pencils, banging head
on wall, searching for loose cords to use, etc.).
• Significant Event Report dated 2/26/23 regarding Youth B
and the hand sanitizer states Staff noticed a large bottle of
hand sanitizer in Youth B’s room, but Youth B refused to
give it to staff. Staff 4 came to the unit and retrieved the
hand sanitizer as well as a drinking cup with hand sanitizer
in it. Youth B admitted to drinking hand sanitizer.
• Wedgwood Christian Services Client Search Procedures
(rev. 8/23/22) outlines procedures for searching youth
bedrooms.
• Residential Initial Service Plan regarding Youth B dated
11/23/22 notes Youth B has a history of consuming alcohol
during AWOL from her previous placement at a different
CCI. Youth B is in substance abuse treatment due to use of
marijuana and vaping nicotine.
• Staff 1 does not have any disciplinary records in her
employee file. Staff 1’s Residential Shadow Shift Checklist
states she received training on the Suicide Precautions
Protocol by Therapist between 1/5/23-1/7/23.
• Staff 2 has two disciplinary records in his employee file
unrelated to this investigation. Staff 2 completed
Adolescent Suicide Prevent training on 12/2/20. Staff 2’s
Residential Shadow Shift Checklist states he received
training on the Suicide Precautions Protocol by Therapist
between 9/26/22-9/29/22.
10

• Staff 3 has five disciplinary records in her employee file
unrelated to this investigation. Staff 3 completed
Adolescent Suicide Prevention training on 10/17/19. Staff 3
does not have any documentation she completed Suicide
Precautions Training.
• Staff 4 does not have any disciplinary records in her
employee file. Staff 4 completed Suicide Training for Direct
Care Staff on 10/24/22.
• Staff 5 has one disciplinary record in her employee file
unrelated to this investigation. Staff 5 completed
Adolescent Suicide Prevention training on 8/12/20. Staff 5
does not have any documentation she completed Suicide
Precautions Training.
• Therapist does not have any disciplinary records in her
employee file. Therapist completed 2020 Suicide Protocols
on 11/18/2020 and 12/15/2020, Best Practices in Suicide
Screening and Assessment on 1/25/22 and Team Training
Suicide Precaution on 6/21/22.
• Supervisor 1 does not have any disciplinary records in her
employee file. Supervisor 1 completed Adolescent Suicide
Prevention on 2/6/20, 2020 Suicide Protocols on 12/15/20,
Addressing Suicide in Adolescents and Transition Age
Youth on 3/9/21 and Team Training Suicide Precaution on
6/21/22.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance as staff were aware of
Youth A’s self-harm/suicidal history yet during the incident
surrounding Youth A did not know she left the milieu and were
unable to provide a timeframe for how long Youth A was not within
their direct line of sight. As a result, Youth A was able to gain
access to laundry detergent and allegedly consumed it.
The agency is found in noncompliance as the staff present during
the incident surrounding Youth B did not appropriately supervise
her once they were aware of her plan to use the alcohol-based
hand sanitizer to get drunk. Youth B was left unsupervised while
Staff 5 went to tell Supervisor 1 what occurred. When Staff 5
returned, she did not continue to directly monitor her until Staff 4
arrived. Additionally, Youth B has substance abuse history and
had access to alcohol-based hand sanitizer. Two youth, including
Youth B had alcohol-based hand sanitizer in their bedroom, yet no
11

staff could account for when or how the youth obtained the
sanitizer.
Technical Assistance:
• The facility should be more diligent in logging/searching
items received as gifts or restricting access to potentially
harmful liquids. Although the situations were different and
occurred on different units, this is the second time a youth
on East Campus has consumed alcohol-based hand
sanitizer. No one knew where the hand sanitizer with
alcohol came from, and it was learned Youth B and another
youth on this unit each had a bottle in their respective
rooms.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
SIR 2022C0103012 dated 5/2/2022; CAP Approved 6/14/2022
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’
needs, implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of
residents.
Violation Additional Rule Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Facility did not follow policy related to suicide prevention and
precautions.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 3/8/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported she worked 2nd shift on
2/26/23. When she started her shift, Youth A told Staff 1 she was
having negative thoughts, felt sad, and said she wished she could
overdose. Staff 1 told Supervisor 1 about the feelings and
thoughts Youth A was having. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A should
not have access to any sharps but did not give any other
instructions or put any other precautions in place.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on 3/8/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported she worked 7am-3pm on
2/26/23. Staff 3 reported Youth A was a little dysregulated in the
afternoon and came out of her room crying at one point. Staff 3
reported Youth A was not on any precautions during her shift.
Staff 5 was interviewed via phone on 3/24/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 reported during staff debrief
between 1st and 2nd shift, Staff 3 told her not to prop any doors
12

open and be mindful of her surroundings because Youth A was
upset, and they did not want Youth A to harm herself.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed via phone on 3/8/23 in
conjunction with MDHHS Worker and again on 4/12/23.
Supervisor 1 reported Youth A finished a Zoom call during 1st shift
on 2/26/23 and was acting a little different. Supervisor 1 asked
Youth A if she was okay and Youth A said yes and asked for
scissors to take down her hair. Supervisor 1 asked Staff 1 to
assist Youth A so Youth A would not have access to any sharps
because Youth A can be unpredictable, especially when she is
upset. Supervisor 1 reported Youth A was not on a suicide
precaution risk status prior to this incident occurring. Supervisor 1
reported Staff 1 never told her Youth A stated she felt bad, was
having negative thoughts, and wished she could overdose.
Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 told her Youth A seemed upset, but
it is not unusual for a youth to feel upset after a phone call with
family. Supervisor 1 reported if she was told those specific
statements, a call to the on-call clinician would have been made
immediately.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/1/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker and via phone on 4/17/23.
Therapist reported Youth A has been on precautions frequently
since being at the facility but has not had an Individualized
Program Modification (IPM) Plan since being in the program.
Therapist stated prior to this incident, Youth A had not been on
precautions since 2/1/23. Youth A was placed on at-risk

because she was not actively seeking to self-harm and only made

were instructed to monitor calls between Youth A and her family,
monitor her behavior after calls, monitor her very closely, and not
allow her access to any of her personal sharp items without

were kept locked up in the staff office and Youth A could request
them and utilize them under staff supervision. Therapist also
reported Youth A’s psychiatric appointments were increased to
weekly and as requested to address Youth A’s concerns with her
medications and make changes as deemed necessary by the
psychiatrist. Therapist stated Youth A had an upsetting Zoom call
with her siblings earlier on 2/26/23, which triggered her, and she

started feeling very hopeless. Therapist reported if on-call clinician

DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:

to the hospital and when she returned, she was placed on
high-risk precautions.
• Wedgwood Christian Services Suicide Prevention Policy
(rev. 3/21/19) and Suicide Precautions Table (rev.

based on at risk, high risk and maximum risk youth. If staff
note risk factors or concerns regarding client safety, those
concerns should be immediately reported to the on-call
clinician on weekends, who will make an evaluation for

• Suicide Precaution Forms: there was a suicide precaution
form for 2/26/23 labeling Youth A high risk after the incident

Analysis The facility violated their suicide prevention and precautions
policy/procedures. Staff 1, Staff 3, Staff 5 and Supervisor 1 all
